title: The Day of Atonement
summary: Leviticus 16 introduces the Day of Atonement (Yom Kippur), an annual ceremony where the high priest enters the Most Holy Place to atone for the sins of Israel. Two goats are used—one sacrificed and the other sent into the wilderness as a scapegoat.

faq.question: What was the purpose of the Day of Atonement?
faq.answer: To cleanse the people and the tabernacle from all their sins once a year.

faq.question: What is the scapegoat?
faq.answer: A goat symbolically bearing Israel’s sins, released into the wilderness to show sin being removed.
